ai.summary: A 11.6 km moderate hike around the Great Yarmouth area in the UK, combining historical interest related to the former workhouse with coastal and town scenery. The route is suitable for walkers with some fitness who enjoy a mix of streets, footpaths, and open spaces.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including paved town streets, compacted trails, and grassy paths. Expect flat to gently undulating ground with occasional uneven sections and potential mud after rain. Coastal winds can affect comfort.
ai.safety_notes: Check local tide times and weather before setting out, as portions of coastal paths may be affected by tides or wind. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers; bring a waterproof jacket. Stay on marked paths, watch for uneven surfaces and gates/stiles, and carry a charged phone and basic first aid. Let someone know your plan if hiking alone and be mindful of crowds if routes pass through urban areas.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or waterproof footwear
Map or GPS device and a charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) offer the best daylight and mild weather; year-round hiking is possible, but winter conditions can be harsher and some paths may be muddy or restricted.

seo.title: Great Yarmouth Workhouse Walk – 11.6 km Moderate Hike in Norfolk, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 11.6 km Great Yarmouth Workhouse Walk, a moderate route that blends history and coastal scenery in the UK. Practical tips on terrain, safety, and gear.
